paper_abstract: Functional heteroscedastic measurement error models are investigated aiming to assess the effects of perturbations of data on some inferential procedures. This goal is accomplished by resorting to methods of local influence. The techniques provide to the practitioner a valuable tool that enables to identify potential influential elements and to quantify the effects of perturbations in these elements on results of interest. An illustrative example with a real data set is also reported. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Local influence assessment in heteroscedastic measurement error models
